meanings.definition: To make a sharp, shrill noise
meanings.sent1: The kettle dirls when it boils.
meanings.sent2: The whistle dirls loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The teapot dirls happily on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The wind dirls through the trees like a ghostly whisper.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock dirls to wake me up every morning.

meanings.sent1: The sudden dirls of the fire alarm startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The dirls of the birds filled the morning air.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected dirls of laughter echoed in the room.
meanings.sent4: The piercing dirls of the ambulance siren cut through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The joyful dirls of the children playing outside brought a smile to my face.

meanings.definition: To pierce or penetrate with a sharp, shrill noise
meanings.sent1: The sound of the nail dirls through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent2: Her scream dirls through the night, waking up the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mosquito dirls annoyingly around my head.
meanings.sent4: His words dirl through my heart like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The arrow dirls through the air, hitting the target with precision.
